chargeHist.descr: Tampering w/ a Global Positioning System Tracking Device

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew G Harrison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants credit for 40 days. Court grants good time and huber or work release.
Concurrent with: any sentence currently serving.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court.  Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.

Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew G Harrison

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew G Harrison in court, in custody.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Matthew G Harrison.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

4:19  Court relates and gives appearances.
4:19  Court questions defendant.
4:22  State relates.
4:23  Atty. Taber makes argument.
4:25  Matthew makes statement.
4:32  Court relates.

Count #1:  State moves to amend to 943.01(1) a class A misdemeanor criminal damage to property; Court grants.  Defendant pleads guilty. Court finds factual basis to accept plea and finds defendant guilty of same.

6 months jail concurrent with any sentence currently serving, with credit for 40 days served including today, with good time, and huber or work release.

Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample. 
Pay costs to include a DNA surcharge; 60 days to pay.

(MS scanned to jail)

Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
NOH sent to Def at Barron Co Jail

10:30 AM Defendant Matthew G Harrison appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video for Matthew G Harrison.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Taber relates time limits are waived, preliminary examination requested.  Attorney Taber requests DE's address be updated to Barron County Jail as he will be held until at least November.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

(MS scanned to jail)
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:23 PM Defendant Matthew G Harrison appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Matthew G Harrison, for today.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court relates. 
State requests a signature bond.  Attorney Rockow has no objection. 
Bond set. 

Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
